contentrichtext.text: {{citations|date=July 2012}} {{Infobox person | name = Yōichi Takahashi | image = Yōichi Takahashi - Lucca Comics & Games 2011.jpg | image_size = 250px | caption = Yōichi Takahashi at [[Lucca Comics & Games]] 2011 | birth_name = | birth_date = July 28, 1960 | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | nationality = Japanese | residence = [[Katsushika, Tokyo|Katsushika]], [[Tokyo]] | known_for = [[Sports]] [[manga]] | occupation = [[Mangaka|Manga artist]] | website = }} {{nihongo|'''Yōichi Takahashi'''|高橋 陽一|Takahashi Yōichi|born July 28, 1960}} is a Japanese cartoonist and [[Mangaka|manga artist]], best known for his work ''[[Captain Tsubasa]]''. ==Works== Yoichi Takahashi has had many items published including art books, manga, novels, and guides, most of which are of about his manga ''Captain Tsubasa''. And popular soccer anime, Hungry Heart Wild Striker. ===Manga=== * ''[[100 M. Jumper]]'' * ''[[Ace!|Ace''!'']]'' (1990–1991, in [[Weekly Shōnen Jump]]) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa]]'' (1981–1988, in [[Weekly Shōnen Jump]]) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa|Captain Tsubasa: All Star Game]]'' (one-shot) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa|Captain Tsubasa: FCRB]]'' (one-shot) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa|Captain Tsubasa: Final Countdown]]'' (one-shot) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa|Captain Tsubasa: GOLDEN–23]]'' (2005- current, [[Weekly Young Jump]]) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa|Captain Tsubasa: Golden Dream]]'' (one-shot) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa|Captain Tsubasa: I am Taro Misaki]]'' (one-shot) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa|Captain Tsubasa: Japan Dream 2006]]'' (one-shot) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa|Captain Tsubasa: Millennium Dream]]'' (one-shot) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa|Captain Tsubasa: ROAD TO 2002]]'' (2001–2004, in [[Weekly Young Jump]]) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa|Captain Tsubasa: ROAD TO 2002 - GO FOR 2006]]'' (5 chapters, in [[Weekly Young Jump]]) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa|Captain Tsubasa: Saikyo no teki: Holland Youth]]'' (one-shot) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa|Captain Tsubasa: Tanpenshuu DREAM FIELD]]'' (one-shot) * ''[[Captain Tsubasa|Captain Tsubasa: World Youth Saga]]'' (1994–1997, in [[Weekly Shōnen Jump]]) * ''[[Chibi (manga)|Chibi]]'' (1992–1993, in [[Weekly Shōnen Jump]]) * ''[[Hungry Heart: Wild Striker]]'' (2002–2004, in [[Weekly Shōnen Champion]]) * ''[[Sho no Densetsu]]'' ===Guides=== * ''Captain Tsubasa: 3109 Nichi Zenkiroku'' ===Novels=== * ''Goalkeeper'' ==External links== {{Commons category|Yōichi Takahashi}} * [http://www.s-manga.net/comics/cm_20070518_wj_sbc_9784086186339_ace-1k.html Ace''!'' Vol.1 at S-Manga.Net] * [http://www.s-manga.net/comics/cm_20060217_yj_yjc_4088770374_captaintsubasa-g23-1k.html Captain Tsubasa GOLDEN-23 Vol.1 at S-Manga.Net] {{Authority control|VIAF=51602521}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Takahashi, Yoichi | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Manga artist | DATE OF BIRTH = July 28, 1960 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Takahashi, Yoichi}} [[Category:1960 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Manga artists]] [[Category:Manga artists from Tokyo]] [[Category:People from Tokyo]] [[Category:Captain Tsubasa]]
